Oh, and this turkey is long. Even at an hour and three quarters it's way, _way_ too long. Perhaps that is because of all the gags stretched out to painful, unfunny conclusion. I want to get my nearly two hours back, but they're gone forever. Be forewarned so that you, too don't lose precious entertainment time.

review_title: Would have made a better Sci-Fi feature then a comedy.
review_detailed_main: Overall, the special affects and story plot was good, just to much comedy where the slapstick failed to appeal to the more serious Sci-fi fan that I am. Would have made a better Sci-Fi feature then a comedy spoof. The Story line was good, take out 3/4 the comedy and insert some serious dialog and drama, where the characters are redeemed by their success in overcoming the foe in the story and saving the world from the awful jokes, dirty language, and infantile behavior. I believe this remake from a Saturday morning serial could have been given better justice then it was given. After all if we are to believe that we can find ourselves in another dimension full of some very scary situations, then lets scare the pants off us, and then make us cheer for the characters when they prevail over a very dramatic and challenging adventure to finding themselves back home all in one piece.

review_title: Not an homage, more like a joke
review_detailed_main:
I agree with the critics on this one. This was one awful movie, barely watchable especially after being a fan of the original series. Will Ferrell's jokes bomb most of the time and I found nothing funny about the sexual innuendos - it was like they were thrown in just to attempt some humor - they failed miserably.

The movie was poorly paced, the character's names remained the same but not the relationships, and there was very little chemistry between the characters. I just really didn't care about them at all. Will's character was barely introduced before the big time altering event. Chaka was not cute in the slightest way (more like homely) - I am not sure how that comment made it to the final cut (yes it was that bad). The best bit in the movie was the walnut. All in all, Grumpy really should have eaten Rick Marshall and cut this movie to about half of what it was.

Really super disappointed in this remake - the Bewitched remake in comparison was 5 stars!

review_title: Land of the Lost adventure comedy with Will Ferrell
review_detailed_main: Land of the Lost adventure comedy with Will Ferrell. Land of the Lost doesn't claim anything, it's a perfectly easy movie to watch for once. The journey itself in historical eras is mediocre, the visual series is not the strongest point of the film. Jokes are not particularly unique, and rather primitive. For the budget of such a film, special effects are made very mediocre, in some more budget films they look much better. Overall, The Lost World can be praised for its family-friendly viewing experience and "toilet" humour. Will Ferrell played great in the film, he is perfectly given such roles. And this is probably the most stupid film about tachyons and time travel.

Love Will Ferrell even when he played for the Padres it's his style of comedy and you haven't notice this is a remake of the original. It's available on Starz. He builds a cheesy time machine device and gets a girl whom what's a cheesy romance she has been following up on Dr Marshall. Comparing the two versions is not the same type of film. He did pretty well for a remake but the plot is very mushy. It has an introduction and conclusion with characters development and techno science doesn't even need to make sense.
This is a great adventure movie with good acting and a lot of comical moments. This is one of my favorite movies of all time and I enjoy rewatching it.

I had basically no expectations for this movie when we recently saw it on HBO. But it won me over by the end. Yes, the movie has its share of gross humor. But it also has two absolutely brilliant gags that made me laugh as hard as I have ever laughed at a movie (what happens when they initially encounter the pylon, and the bit with the giant crab). Also, it is clear that everyone in the movie is putting their all into it. The Sleestaks are clearly guys in rubber suits, but they're very good rubber suits, and they only fit loosely on their actors in one very specific circumstance. The computer-animated dinosaurs clearly aren't really there in the scene, but they're pretty well done. And the animation that they did for the closing credits was far better than it had any need to be. Now if you'll excuse me, I'm hungry for some chorizo tacos.

review_title: Pretty slow and bad, some decent parts though
review_detailed_main:
There is a good deal of filler in this movie, and scenes take way too long. Most often this occurs with scenes with no redeeming elements, such as when one character translates the prehistoric language of another. It keeps going on, and is only lamely jokey at best, but never humorous.

The low-grade visual effects aren't really bothersome at all; they are actually somewhat interesting. Some are slightly amusing, but they are never bad enough to be actually funny.

Ferrell is fine overall, but the material is too lame for him to make much out of it. He has a few decent scenes/lines/gags. The other guy is visually and aurally unpleasant and has no business having a major role in a movie. Strictly a character actor. The prehistoric man character is terrible for the same reasons.

The inclusion of Matt Lauer is the best part of the movie. There are some good shots of his hair, though you keep wishing the director had held them for longer.

review_title: One of the worst actors, with one of the best.
review_detailed_main:
Within the first minute of this film I knew I was gonna hate it. And I did. I was gonna turn this off but then the amazing Anne Friel came on screen and made it bearable.

I find anything that has had Will Ferral star in or had any contact to is a completely terrible film and I haven't been wrong yet. The fact that he does things that he thinks are funny and in the process he looks like a 3 year old child having a temper tantrum. It isn't funny and it makes me cringe.

If they had gone with Jack Black as it was hinted they might in the trivia this film may of made more than half the production costs, simply because Jack Black is funny.

The reason I gave it 5 stars is simply because of Anne Friel and her amazing accent. So i recommend you only see it if you like Friel, because thats the only reason i did.

Have never been a big fan of Will Ferrell's movies (Talladega Nights, Anchorman, etc.) even though I thought he was hilarious in just about everything he did on SNL.

This movie, however, caught me by surprise because Will's middle-class/suburban jokes/references fit right in to the storyline and tone. The supporting cast were also given lots of punchlines. I laughed and giggled throughout.

It's funny to see such hi-level CGI used for such a silly film, so I recommend this movie to people who just want a silly laugh and cool effects (ie.stoners!).

This is by far my favourite Will Ferrell film.

review_title: Land of lost hope and everything, actually...

review_detailed_main: My only concern about this film is "Why is the main character - Rick Marshall - named after one of the primary suspects in the real-life Zodiac murders of the late 1960's, early 70's? This seems either a result of improper research or a horrible attempt at gallows humor. What's your take?

review_title: A silly farce of a film
review_detailed_main:
If you were a fan of the TV series, don't watch this film expecting it to be loyal to the original characters. If you do, it's gonna suck for you. This is a Will Ferrell vehicle, plain and simple. If you take it on its own merits, it's watchable. The humor is simple and juvenile, but often laugh out loud funny. The plot is a bit inane... but it's a Will Ferrell movie... duh. Anna Friel was one of the film's saving graces, as was the actor who played Chaka.

I gave the film 3 stars mostly because it did not stay loyal to the original characters and made a walking joke of Rick Marshall. I can only hope that someday, someone will make a film that actually pays homage to the original series.

If you understand comedy this movie will be a fun one to watch. Watched it when it came out in 2009 and is till one of my favorites. Ignore the bad reviews please and give it a chance. Very very fun funny movie. Top 3 Will Ferrell movies. The Matt Lauer scenes get me every time.

review_title: Steven Spielberg should direct this movie and make it more Jurrasic Park like
review_detailed_main: Even I thought this movie is good, but the movie grossed fifty million dollars in America which however this movie is a box office flop. If Steven Spielberg directed this movie, like he did for Jurrassic Park one and two, Steven would be make this movie a success if he directed the movie. Will (William) Ferrell should not play Doctor Rick Marshall, it should be played by Brendan Fraiser like he did for his movie Journey to the Center of the Earth. If Brendan Fraiser played Doctor Rick Marshall, he would be a terrific choice instead of Will (William) Ferrell. What happened to Spencer Milligan, Ron Harper, Wesley Eure and Kathy (Kathleen) Colman-Bell? Should these four people have cameo appearances?

Well this film was just utterly disappointing. Despite knowing the film is a spoof/sequel on the original 1974 tv series with bad reviews from critics and movie goers the film is just plain bad.

The film stars Will Ferrell as a paleontologist who becomes inspired to re-examine his work by an English research student and is accompanied by a gift shop owner and an "ape" like creature as they attempt to return to Earth and save it from a possible destruction.

Even though I never watched the original tv series, I expected some "winks" at the audience for obvious references to the show but I noticed nothing. The film was dull despite me being a fan of Will Ferrell and Danny McBride. Characters were bland, one-dimensional, and not funny. There were a few funny moments but overall the story didn't make sense the humor couldn't get started.

Not worth watching even as a Will Ferrell fan.

I went in with high expectations and was shot down terribly . The jokes were stupid and the plot was garbage. It had such potential, such promise. He went from step brothers to this? Why, will, why?

Will ferral plays a hasbit scientist, Dr.Marshal, that believes he can invent a machine that can travel to alternate universes. He invents this machine and goes to an alternate universe, filled with lizard people, dinosaours, and giant walnuts. He is joined with a fellow scientist, Holly, and a tourguide, Will. They go on an adventure in the land of the lost and try to get home.

Sigh

Now the critics who are blaming it for not doing justice to the original, well, it is supposed to be a spoof. And this is one of the movies where you just need to shut down your higher brain functions and sit back. It was funny in bits and pieces, but like almost all average spoofs, it did not have a plot to hold on to. But that does not mean that deserves the harsh reviews. It makes you laugh( even though you don't know why), and that way it is quite good. And yet the absolute lack of plot or character development is pitiable. Not a movie to waste money on by buying DVDs or watching it in cinema, but definitely worth a watch on the cable TV( if you have the time).

review_title: "All right gangsta, let's bones it out!"

review_detailed_main: The movie is very bad and the dialogue is not funny the movie does not respect the viewer's mentality. It cannot be classified as children Nor can it be classified as for adults. I don't know where the $ 100 million budget went and what is the result of this spending. This movie is not appropriate for a large company or Hollywood., very rudimentary and the movement of actors slow.
For me its an amazing movie that ive seen 10 times. I can imagine it only works with a certain type of humour but i loved it.

I always expect a Will Ferrell movie to be silly bordering on absurd, and that's OK so long as it's funny. "Land of the Lost" was not. Will Ferrell and Danny McBride ham it up while Anna Friel plays the straight woman in this forgettable sci-fi comedy about dinosaurs, aliens, and ape-people.

Dr. Rick Marshall (Will Ferrell) invented a device called a tachyon amplifier that was able to create a portal to other points in time and space. He and an admirer named Holly (Anna Friel) used the tachyon amplifier to enter the land of the lost. There they had death defying adventures with their unwilling tagalong Will (Danny McBride) as they tried to recover the tachyon amplifier to get back home. The longer the movie ran the dumber it got, and the dumber it got the more unfunny it became until we were left with tears of sadness for ever thinking this movie could be good. Make sure you have a nebulizer handy after watching this so that you can erase it from your memory.

review_title: Somewhat funny movie marred by religious intolerance
review_detailed_main:
The movie was okay. Not a lot of really funny scenes. Some of the trailers have spoiled the punchlines. The main bone I have with it though is the Jesus joke that Will Ferrell makes in a semi-intoxicated scene. It is in really poor taste and it should have been cut.

It is a shame that Ferrell has to make fun of the beliefs of millions of people in order to make a bad joke. No one in the movie theater laughed at this or really most of the jokes in the movie. One of the problems also with this movie is that the series was a family one. So some people may believe that this is a family movie too. Which it is not. All kind of jokes in here including Vibrator references, A lot of Bathroom humor and also some implied monkeyman to man love. Which is just wrong on so many levels.

My take if you like adult humor and random plot movement see the Hangover. Much funnier in my opinion.

I got this in the $5 bin at Wal-Mart. After falling asleep multiple times while trying to watch it, I've come to the conclusion this is one of the worst movies I've ever seen. Not funny. It does have good special effects in spots that don't save it. There are also some really bad special effects that appear to be a tribute to the original show. Since the acting and scenarios are so unfunny, the Director and writers resorted to lots of boob, crotch, urine and feces jokes. I grew up watching the original campy version on Saturday mornings. This is neither campy or serious. And I've wasted enough of my time writing this for such a bad movie.

OK first of all this movie is supposed to be a parody of the original show because the original show was so poorly made and had such bad acting i mean you can't say you enjoy the original series and danny mcbride and will ferrell i think did a great job and had great chemistry in this movie, and take a look at the rating people complaining about it not being family friendly it's PG-13 meaning anyone under 13 should not be watching it so there's that and if you don't like will ferrell why'd you go see it and why are you posting comments and problems with it people these days are so ignorant when it comes to movies and it had great entertainment value and good laughs but if your not a will ferrell fan that shouldn't be your concern now if you liked will ferrell but just didn't like the movie why not post a comment because you have a reasonable explanation.

I am a huge Will Ferrell fan, but this was just a god awful film. An absolute "bus crashing into a wall" wreck. Where should I begin to explain it?

There were uncomfortable awkward silences in the living room with my friends after lines that were clearly supposed to be humorous were not. There were offensive multiple blatant sexual references (telling the woman to sit on the vibrating crystal, primates grab her breasts multiple times, and worse). It went on and on and then the drug references started. There is no way this film should have been rated PG-13. This film was not exceptionally well-written or even a slightly entertaining film.

The special effects were absolutely terrible and looked fake. Don't get me wrong, I wasn't expecting this to be a high-end film, but I've seen better effects on old-school Atari games. I wanted to slow down the motion on the DVD player, because I was certain that you could see the necks sticking out of some of the cast members that were in costumes! The only reason I didn't do that is it would have upset the people I was watching it with further.

This movie was stupidly boring. I didn't expect it to be that funny - as Will Ferrell's recent comedies haven't impressed me a whole lot and seem very repetitive.

I just was expecting to be so utterly bored.

"Land of the Lost" TV series was meant for kids of the 1970s, and wasn't real deep entertainment, just a simple adventure show. It actually made it to syndication, and where it achieved some notoriety, it never made it to "cult status" so to speak. So why on Earth make a comedy out of it?

I'm not a big "Land of the Lost" fanboy, ergo I'm not all that offended by a comedy made of it, but just on kind of a basic principle of taste, why turn a children's adventure show into a raunch comedy that isn't all that funny in the first place?

Those of you who've read my previous reviews you know my opinion on Wil Ferrel's comedy (or lack of it), which makes one wonder why he or his agents thought making this movie was a good idea.

Land of the Lost was just another Kroft Saturday morning show, although it was probably their more sensible show, and as an avid watcher when I was a boy, it didn't deeply resonate with me, though I did like it. I never got deeply into the show, so I didn't buy any of the schlock that the so-called producers were peddling (and quite frankly, I don't remember all that much "Land of the Lost" merchandise).

And I think that's true for most kids who watched this show. So why on Earth was this film made in the first place? Someone thought there was enough of an audience that would pay to see an alleged "send-up" of a children's show. Someone, somewhere, thought it was a good idea. Huh.

A better film would have been to pay homage to the original TV series, and perhaps aim it at kids as opposed to creating some embarrassingly unfunny film, starring an actor who isn't that funny in the first place.

Regrettably this was not the case, and what we have left is a very high budget film with a lot of gloss and not much else. I think maybe I laughed once, but perhaps guardedly so.

Fortunately I didn't help flip the bill nor work on this very poor film. If you're going to make a comedy, then at least have a reason for doing so, and put some smarts into the thing. I mean "Land of the Lost" is a product of the 1970s, but "The Goodbye Girl" this thing ain't. Which is even more baffling since "The Goodbye Girl" was aimed at the same adult age bracket, but had more drama and funnier moments than anything Wil Ferrel and his team could conjure.

"Land of the Lost" may have been shot on the cheap like a lot of Kroft productions, but that doesn't automatically make it a subject for humor. Sure, we can probably poke fun as it as adults, but "Land of the Lost" was made for children who liked dinosaurs.

How come a movie for kids who like dinosaurs couldn't be made?

One wonders.

This was just your generic not very good adventure movie It's probably one of Will Ferrell's worst roles. The only part I liked was the special effects of the t-rex. It looked fairly realistic. But having the t-rex understand what Dr. Marshall was saying was silly. Like he kept saying the dinosaur has a brain the size of a walnut, then later the t-rex gives him this huge nut. And I still don't get the caveman companion. When they first see him, it's like he's in ancient Egypt, then they fall through a hole in the sand and land on bones and see the t-rex in a few minutes.

With a script like this, this movie just should not have been made.

FINAL VERDICT: will cause brain cell damage

Although I'm not the biggest will Farrel fan in the world, I'll eventually get round to giving his films a go. Land of the Lost turned up on HBO so I sat and watched... I'd already checked the summary here; the stars weren't too low so I stuck it out. Big mistake. One of the worst big budget movies I've seen in a very long time. The estimate of $100,000,000 for this pile of manure must surely be a mistake. Where did the money go? $30 million for Will? $20 million for Anna, 10c for the other guy? That still leaves (after my very over inflated suggestions (I reckon Anna really us about a tenth of the above) where did the other 50million get spent? There's no significant cast other than the main three characters? The effects are nothing unusual for this day and age, and some of it reminded me of Mork & Mindy days they were so basic. The script was so awful, they clearly weren't paying much for that. Musical score? Nope, mostly out of copyright show tunes. Someone, please explain to me: Where did the money go?

review_title: Insulting view of a wonderful series
review_detailed_main:
The original series was a wonderful mind blowing experience. The concepts and world building are wonderful, rivaling even Star Trek and Star Wars.

Yes, it was (very) low budget, but who cares? Those darn sleestacks remain quite scary to me. And Eenuk's life is extremely tragic.

The soap opera production values are of course silly, but the pylons and the crystals, and the wrap around world.

Screw this movie for taking a wonderful world and reducing it to the most unimaginable moments.

review_title: Simply a fun ride of a movie!
review_detailed_main:
This movie was so funny and entertaining! I laughed so many times that I can't count. The Dino's were fantastic. The actors were great and the scenery was awesome. I highly recommend watching "Land of the Lost". You will have a great time! I am not a critic, but I know how to enjoy a fun movie when I see one. Have fun! Enjoy! Laugh! Be amazed! This movie rocks!

Ferrell is Dr. Rick Marshall, a paleontologist with a controversial belief that humans can travel back in time. He gets laughed out of his career. Then, a fan of his, fellow scientist Holly Cantrell (Anna Friel), who left Cambridge University to present him with evidence of time travelers, finds him in relative obscurity lecturing kids at the La Brea Tar Pits.

An artifact leads them to a portal at a roadside Desert tourist trap run by a survivalist showman named Will Stanton (Danny McBride). Using Marshall's Home made Tachyon Device, the trio are plunged into an alternate past with dinosaurs and prehistoric primates like Chaka (Jorma Taccone). There are also the infamous sleestaks.

How could you not love this movie?

I generally like Will Ferrell, and he is enjoyable through much of this mesh of inane dialog, poor acting, lousy script, and incredibly lame version of a dubious television show to say the least. Ferrell is not at fault here at all. The people who wrote the script are for taking yet another 70's show and re-working it to the point of virtually no recognition for the viewer that might have had some chance of seeing in it what were nostalgic memories. The whole premise of the old show is basically cast aside for a story of some scientist who believe in time travel or some crap like that and gets together with a scientist/student who believes in him and some guy running a cave tour. That is the basic cast as we then get into the Land of the Lost via a machine with the music of A Chorus Line playing continually. I wish that the writers of today thought a little more of the composite intellect of their viewers - perhaps they are. The story, at least for me, is so way out there, so silly, and so predictable that I found myself somewhat bored throughout the film. There are some really funny moments with Ferrell, but they are too few and far between - and most of the best were in the trailers and commercials. I wish I had something else to say that the film was revolutionary in some slight way or that it made me think maybe once, but other than a few good laughs this is derivative and condescending for the most part. Just the whole bit about full blown motels and ice cream trucks, etc... - a low for the writers of this film.

review_title: Possibly the most uncomfortable film I've ever seen.
review_detailed_main:
Will Farrel is fine in say the interview sections but the bits where Anna friel and him are on screen together are very uncomfortable to watch.

The film is garbage as well - but - garbage can be ok....

This feels like a warning of what isn't ok and felt at times like if Weinstein had filmed his 'encounters' in hotels and stuck a guy in a shoddy alien costume in the background it would be ok.

It really is that awkward...

review_title: Land of the Lost Is a Movie to Be Forgotten
review_detailed_main:
"Land of the Lost" is not very good, but it's not as offensively awful as critics at the time of its release would have you believe. I've seen much worse, even if that's not exactly a hook on which to hang a recommendation.

What the movie proves more than anything is that even utter absurdity has to be crafted well if it is to be anything other than boring. "Land of the Lost" desperately needed a better screenplay to hold it together. Without it, the movie feels like what it is -- a collection of randomly assorted scenes of people running around chasing or being chased by not overly impressive special effects.

Will Ferrell has some funny moments, but he is only as good as the movie around him, and he can't carry this film. Surprisingly, Danny McBride, playing a redneck who gets sucked into the netherworld with Ferrell's scientist character, comes closest to keeping our interest fully engaged. He's got a strong comic presence that can make even lacklustre material funny. Anna Friel plays the requisite eye candy, and there's some moderate fun to be had in the art direction.

But moderate fun is about as much as this movie ever achieves, and it never achieves even that for very long stretches at a time. "Land of the Lost" is destined for the Movie Land of the Forgotten.

Grade: C

review_title: The Title Is Sadly All Too Appropriate
One of the Best Movies Ever!!!

review_detailed_main: It was bad. Kinda just didn't age well. The jokes are lame. Danny McBride is great tho. I like him. He's got a funny type of character.. the same one he always plays. Not sure why I have to make this review so long

"Land of the Lost" is a totally cheap Si-Fi comedy movie – and is meant only for the unrefined class of people!

PROS of "Land of the Lost"

The Dinosaur looks real (but it does not last for too long)

CONS of "Land of the Lost"

1. Very low-grade comedy

2. Low-grade dialogues

3. Repeated use of the F-word

4. The director is confused about the target audience (kids or the people living in lunatic asylums or is it for the ones living in slums)

5. Implausible events and situations (the actress understands the language of the apes which she had never learned)

6. No sense or logic in the plot

Dr Rick treats Chaka like a slave. According to the movie Chaka is meant to be an earlier "version" of humans. But Rick insists on him being the master in a dominative way. Even if Chaka were a monkey Ricks demeanor shouldn't be that condescending.

review_title: Not Funny, Not good, Not Recommended.

review_detailed_main: Its a comedy, its dumb, smart, and refreshing. the low ratings are sad... just relax and enjoy the stupid stuff. all the low ratings, sheesh... they have the science, and the stupidity of the OG series on point..

You get the gist of the setting from the previews, and it is accurate. If you found the previews hilarious, then see the movie. Most of what's in the previews happens in the first half hour. The rest of the movie is about as funny, or unfunny, depending on your sense of humor. I don't like will Ferrell's goofball characters. IF you do, you'll love this movie. There's a few (What I considered), tedious full-face shots of Ferrell giving his typical long winded, speechy humor drivel. If Ferrell wasn't in this movie I'd have given it 7 starts, for the fun factor and the other actors. I gave it a chance because I DID like Elf and Stranger than Fiction. And I've seen all of Ferrel's movies (I'm a glutton for punishment!) The only thing that leaves you astray in the previews is the family factor. There's a blatant F-U by Ferrell stated concisely to another character, and a joke about getting a woman "wet" (excited), and lots of boob grabbing (clothed). Language is peppered with things you don't want your kids repeating.

I won't cover inconsistencies or mistakes in science or the campiness factor, as I feel all of those were considered unimportant, or were intentional in this movie. It's a kids movie with adult themes.

Very little jumps out as being needed for the big screen. If you're not curious enough to see it in a theater, see it on DVD. You won't be missing much seeing on the little screen.

review_title: Lose This Film Any Place on the Land.
Possibly the worst "comedy" I've ever seen
review_detailed_main: I rated this a "2" because I think the "1" and "10" votes are sort of ignored by people. This is REALLY bad! This made Napolean Dynamite seem like a laugh a second (a movie I walked out of). I would have walked out on this one, but it was in my own living room as a pay-per-view (they had the never to charge $5 for this garbage!). I like most Will Ferrel movies, but the only funny scenes in the whole movie were the opening and closing scenes, where he is being interviewed by Matt Laur. If they had done a whole movie with bits like that, it would have been funny! Will played his usual self in those short scenes. The rest of the movie seemed like they were just putting in the time to shoot each scene. I can't believe people rated this thing as high as 8, 9, or 10? (sometimes I think people associated with a movie flood this site with 10s for their movie) But of course, there were people who thought Napolean Dynamite was funny, so I guess to each his own. I think the most telling indicator that this movie wasn't funny is that my 17-year-old daughter, and 13-year-old son did not laugh at all throughout the movie, other than laughing at how bad it was! Save your time, and/or your money, and avoid this!

I actually love Anna Friel in "Pushing Daisies." This is not a great performance. It isn't even funny. At one point they have her acting as if she's fearless and in another scene she is helpless and rather insipid. She is a much better actress and comedian than the performance she gave here.

No one expect Will Farrell to be a good actor. He wasn't. He is totally unbelievable as a hero. He put in too many senseless scenes that didn't even go along with the movie premise. Of course no one expected this to even have any semblance of realism.

Definitely not a fan of this movie or of Will Ferrell. I was hoping for something a little campy. It had the design and costumes for being a camp classic, instead it was all wasted. It wasn't even cute.

review_title: Not too great, or even a couple of laughs to be had.
review_detailed_main: You can't really turn down any dinosaur movie, unless of course it's called 'Land of the Lost' and starring Will Ferrell. The two stars goes for the skillfully animated T-Rex but can't think who would enjoy it? It's too grown up for kids and too juvenile for adults.

review_title: me and my dad love this movie Soo much
review_detailed_main: So I've watched this movie countless times and I don't see why it gets the hate it does. I mean, I'm no movie expert but I still like it and think it's funny. It's dumb fun for me and I recommend it. I love the acting of every actor in this movie and me and my dad quote this movie all the time. Now this sounds really dumb but I would NOT judge a movie based on reviews before even watching it, you don't know, maybe you'll actually like the movie instead of hate it like the reviews. It was the same with the second Pacific Rim movie, when we bought the dvd I was like "the reviews said it sucked but I've been wanting to watch it for awhile so why not" and I liked it. But give land of the lost a watch it's good.

Will Ferrell isn't funny. Period. I know this and had no illusions he suddenly developed a sense of humor or comedic timing. I saw the tv show as a kid but don't recall much besides dinosaurs.

Neither of those things is the reason for the low rating. The movie isn't funny. It's supposed to be a comedy. It isn't. It's a collection of telegraphed joke setups that never land. Mike Meyers at the height his powers might have been able to pull off the punchlines. Will Farrell had no hope.

Beyond the lack of humor is a serious lack of story. Things keep happening for no reason, taking up screen time and leading nowhere. Then we're off to the next random occurrence. At no point do we have a sense of progression towards anything. The only way this movie was going to end is when the film ran out.

Three stars for attempting to make a comedy. No stars for the casting and the writers who must have had their sense of humor surgically removed. Three stars.
This movie is funny. I didn't watch it for years because of the reviews. Now it's one of my favorite comedies. Top 100.

review_title: As a comedy, it's better than "Year One" (another 2009 release), but most of it is still dull
review_detailed_main:
I remember going to the movie theatre a couple times in May 2009, and think the trailers I saw included one for "Year One" and one for "Land of the Lost", both comedies which came into theatres the following month. I recognized one comedian in each film, with Jack Black in "Year One" and Will Ferrell in "Land of the Lost". I finally saw the former last month and thought it was pretty lame, and now I've seen the latter, which I would say is definitely better than the other, but still not very good. It is based on the TV series of the same from the 1970s, which I'm not familiar with, but I watched this movie because of Ferrell's starring role. I know many people can't stand him as a comedian, but I often find him funny, just not so much in certain films, like this one.

Dr. Rick Marshall is a paleontologist who has been a major target of ridicule since expressing his time warp theories three years ago and now teaches children at the George C. Page Museum, but one person who admires him for his theories is a graduate student named Holly Cantrell, who says he was an inspiration to her. She shows him her findings and convinces him to finish his invention, the tachyon amplifier. The two of them then go to the cave where Holly found her fossil, and are taken on a tour with the cave gift shop owner, Will Stanton as their guide. During the boat ride through the cave, the tachyon amplifier is activated, and the three people aboard the raft are transported to another dimension, where timelines come together! They have lost the amplifier, and soon meet an ape man named Cha-Ka, of the Pakuni tribe, who becomes their guide as they venture through this dangerous Land of the Lost!

We first see Will Ferrell's character, Dr. Rick Marshall, in an interview with Matt Lauer on "Today" to talk about his theories, which causes a fight, first verbal then physical, between the talk show's guest and host. I have to admit, I thought this part was pretty funny. After this, there are some fairly amusing parts early in the film, but it's certainly not hilarious, and as Rick, Holly, Will, and Cha-Ka travel through the land, it's generally very straight-faced. I occasionally smiled or laughed lightly, but usually kept a straight face and found the story a little dull. I didn't find any of the gags revolting, but most of them failed to amuse me, unlike that interview sequence. I've seen Ferrell in a bunch of films, but was unfamiliar with the other three main cast members: Anna Friel (Holly), Danny McBride (Will), and Jorma Taccone (Cha-Ka). None of them really impressed me with their performances. Now, this movie does have some upsides. It's often a visual treat with the cinematography and CGI special effects, and the story may get slightly more exciting towards the end, but these aren't enough to save it.

I've seen 1994's "The Flintstones", 1998's "Lost in Space", and 1999's "Wild Wild West". What these three films have in common is they are all lacklustre movies from the '90s based on TV shows from the '60s. I first saw episodes of the groundbreaking "Flintstones" cartoon series at a very early age, but still haven't seen any episodes of the other two shows. However, that certainly doesn't mean I wouldn't like them. This 2009 version of "Land of the Lost" reminds me of those other three films because it's a movie from the 2000s based on a TV show from the '70s. Also, like the three '90s releases I've mentioned, it's not very good. Like I said, I'm not familiar the show (it was made the decade before I was born), but I think whether you've seen any of the series or not, and whether you like it or not if you have seen it, there's probably no shame in skipping this film adaptation. (That's also what I said about the "Lost in Space" and "Wild Wild West" films, though this "Land of the Lost" adaptation is probably slightly better than those.)

review_title: I was a lost bored boy watching this one!
review_detailed_main: I checked the "lost & found" cinema section for a well-rounded comedic movie this summer and for the obvious reasons "Land of the Lost" was not in there. Which obvious reasons? Well, how much "time travel" time do you have? Director Brad Silberling's movie adaptation of Sid & Marty Kroft cult-famed 70's kid show "Land of the Lost" was a miserable experiment. Will Ferrell stars as obsessed scientist Dr. Rick Marshall who has a Marshall plan to travel in time to visit a land where as he calls it "past, present, and future" are all intertwined. I sure hope Marshall would have given me this land before I saw this movie. Because in the "past", I would have chosen not to see "Land of the Lost", and in the "present" would have been disgruntled at the silliness it offered, and in the "future" would have cried warning to all my friends & acquaintances to avoid it. Back in time to the so-called plot: Eventually, Marshall is sucked up into to some space vortex alongside Holly Cantrell, a research assistant, and Will Stanton, a redneck survivalist. At this Land of the Lost, they befriend a primate named Chaka, who starts singing primate hit songs such as "I'm Every Primate" and "I Feel For You Being Stuck Here". Oops wrong Chaka! That was Chaka Khan! Chaka Khan! Chaka Khan! Chaka Khan! Sorry! Got sucked into the Wrath of Khan! Anyway, the freaky foursome confront T-Rex dinosaurs, space creatures, bubonic-type insects, and more freaky-deaky stuff. They have to find the instrument that landed them in this time warp in order to. Sorry, did not follow the plot too much after that because by that time I was in the "land of the lost interest" from the film's ridiculousness. Silberling and writer Chris Henchy must have been in their own "land of the lost originality" while developing the movie. The film had no engaging structure and its outlandish scenes with the creatures were not amusing whatsoever, and profoundly "over the top". Henchy especially should have hired a writer henchman to aid him in the script, because what Henchy delivered to the "Land of the Lost" was in no man's creative land. Anna Friel as Holly Cantrell was appealing but not for this type of role; I would of had this looker appear instead in "Land of the Lust". Danny McBride as Will Stanton does yet another take on his formulaic redneck character, which by now has gotten to be a real monotonous pain in the redneck, I mean neck. The only mini-savior of "Land of the Lost" was the scene-stealer Chaka. This primitive was prime time with his uproarious gestures, and kudos goes out to Jorma Taccone for his Chaka portrayal. But the rest of "Land of the Lost" should be lost in your memory's past, present, and future! ** Needs Improvement

I'll admit that this is my guilty pleasure movie. I don't know if it is good. It might actually be kind of bad? But it makes me laugh.

Also, "Chuck" from Pushing Up Daisies is in it

review_title: A sort of spoof on the TV series

review_detailed_main:
I decided to wait until either cheapo movies or rental to catch this film. I felt like I made the right call.

Dr. Rick Marshall(Will Ferrell,riffing the way only he can)has some,let's just say,fringe studies and field expertise. He's interested in time travel but his theories and writings have made him a laughingstock of the scientific community(as demonstrated in a fitfully funny early film confrontation/interview with Matt Lauer as himself)and lands him in a high school teaching job that he hates. Things seem to have screeched to a halt on his studies until a plucky--for no apparent reason other than to further the story--graduate student in a similar field named Holly(Anna Friel,very comely as always,but out of step in much of this story).With her help,plus the help of a product placement smörgåsbord of fast food products and the unwitting aid of a deliriously crass park manager(Danny McBride,again stealing scenes!),Marshall with Holly and the ranger in tow are plunged into a sort of complex alternative universe where dinosaurs and quasi-pre-historic cave people cavort in desert plains,caves and abandoned 20th-century structures. Go figure!

Brad Silberman,whose previous projects have ranged from Casper to Moonlight Mile,helms this film which seems to be little more than a Will Ferrell post-SNL showcase(minus an ingenious character such as Ron Burgundy or Ricky Bobby). As such,it's very funny,as Ferrell's commitment to character(much like on-time co-star Sasha Baron Cohen)is skillful and determined to the point of being off-putting. But the film as a whole seems to be half of an idea:make a movie based on a cult classic TV show of yore(Sid and Marty Kroft's "Land of the Lost") but then pretty much dump much of the original material or spirit in favor of a kind of gonzo physical comedy experience,laced with cheesy special effects. It may be trite but it has to be repeated:this movie really only works for you if you dig Ferrell and,to a lesser degree,the kind of relaxed,redneck humor and bravado of McBride. Otherwise a spare cast and a thin plot will leave many movie goers wanting(which,at this writing,it has,being a large box office disappointment for Universal). I believe when I first saw the trailers I believed this would be one of my first summer shows to catch. A slough of bad reviews,some better alternatives that showed up at the time and a tightness of budget changed that,and after seeing this,I cannot say I felt worse for that. An okay film that really isn't worth a rush to see.

review_title: I'm not blaming Danny McBride, but I'm kind of blaming Danny McBride
review_detailed_main: I don't want to put all the blame for Land of the Lost on Danny McBride, but this movie definitely took a sharp turn downward once he entered the story. And then the other characters all seemed to stoop down to his level. They took a family-friendly TV show for kids and turned it into a raunchy, almost-R-rated comedy. And it doesn't seem to know where it's going, most of the time. It's sad, really, because this movie looks good. You can tell they pumped a lot of money into it-right down the toilet.

The only reason I can think as to why Will Ferrell did this movie was to get another paycheck. It is campy, cheesy, and Ferrell really hammed in his acting. Ferrell is much better than this. He could have so much with this role. It felt like he was trying to force the jokes rather than let the jokes come in naturally. His co-stars Anna Friel and Danny McBride are also much better than the junk that is this movie. It also felt like they were trying to force their lines as well. The dialogue in this was really campy and the special effects were incredibly cheesy.

This movie is easily a horrible TV adaptation. It could have been so much better. I feel like director Brad Silberling could have done so much more with this material and the actors he had in this. Don't waste your time time on this. If you want a good Will Ferrell comedy, go watch Elf or Blades of Glory or Talladega Nights.

review_title: Just more of the same from Will.
review_detailed_main:
To compare this to the original TV series would be wrong. Not because that was a cheap Sid & Marty Kroft production but because these two things are nothing alike except for the name and a couple small plot points. This is a Will Ferrell stoner comedy and should be treated like one.

Here's the thing, I don't like Will Ferrell. I don't think he's funny and it amazes me that he has the following he does. But I do love bad movies and since this wasn't rated very highly by the critics I figured I'd give it a shot when it happened to pass on some streaming site. And honestly I wish I hadn't. This is just an excuse for Will to do his thing which is scream loudly, act like a man child, fall over repeatedly and at some point get stoned. I swear he does this in every single movie he's in.

The story itself is unremarkable. Basic jist is three people wind up going to an alien world / other dimension where dinosaurs, cave people and giant whatevers exist. There also seems to be some kind of connection between that world and ours because you occasionally see glimpses of things that have fallen from our world to this one.

It really boils down to this. If you like Will Ferrell then you'll like this. If you don't then you won't.

I think this was marketed to the wrong audience. I was cracking up. If you're a Danny McBride fan and were raised on Adult Swim, give this a watch on a slow night. Definitely had me and my buddy laughing!

review_title: This Film Belongs To Jurrasic Park Franshise
somewhat funny but not that great
review_detailed_main:
The movie was okay. Not a lot of really funny scenes. Some of the trailers have spoiled the punchlines. Some parts felt really boring and hard to watch, its sort of a mix up. This movie isn't all that bad but surely its not that great. Also many parts were really stupid, like those lizard/reptile guys and those dinosaur scenes.

It is a shame that Ferrell has to make fun of the beliefs of millions of people in order to make a bad joke. One of the problems also with this movie is that the series was a family one. So some people may believe that this is a family movie too. Which it is not. All kind of jokes in here including Vibrator references, A lot of Bathroom humor and also some implied monkeyman to man love. Which is just wrong on so many levels. (it involves Ferrell making out with their monkey friends...just sick) The first part of the movie seemed boring, then it got better fast. It had somehwhat action but not really. The ending with Matt Lauer was hilarious.

==================================================================== ====================================================================

After years of a rewatch 08/04/17' Land of the Lost remains one of Will Ferrell's biggest misfires of his career. This film was a big flop and quickly became forgettable. There are some laughs but the overall premise isn't as intriguing or interesting.

"Land of the Lost" is a Comedy - Sci-Fi movie in which we watch a scientist with two other people getting into a space-time vortex and going into a world full of dinosaurs.

I have to admit that I had high expectations from this movie mainly because of Will Ferrell, unfortunately I was disappointed by it. The plot of the movie was simple, nice and it could be interesting and enjoyable but it was filled with some boring scenes that ruined its flow. The interpretation of Will Ferrell who played as Dr. Rick Marshall was good but I believe he did not reach his potential. Finally, I have to say that "Land of the Lost" is a poor comedy movie and if you are a fan of Will Ferrell I recommend you to skip it.

(2009) Land of the Lost COMEDY

Co-executive produced and directed by Brad Silberling that consist of a silly plot, that has Dr. Rick Marshall (Will Ferrel) and company traveling back into prehistoric time to prove to the local media, especially NBC co-host Matt Lauer playing himself, that the investment of a time machine wasn't a waste of tax payers money. Supposed to be a comedy, but all I got instead are a few chuckles and smiles. Danny McBride also stars as Brad's best friends Will Stanton. Though it is not the worst comedy I had ever seen! Kids should be able to enjoy this more than adults.

Movie was hilarious from the opening scene to closing, draws you in, and never slows down. I would compare this movie in pacing to The Mummy, it isn't an award winning mind-melter, it is just plain fun and comical. If you already hate Will Ferrell or Danny McBride than don't see this movie but if you enjoyed any of their other films or roles than this movie will entertain you for more than the ticket's worth. Both him and Danny McBride are golden together. A side note is that this is very pg-13 and filled with jokes for adults though most are double meaning and will fly over the little one's heads. Just sit back, relax and have a good time with some good laughs.

review_title: It's time for stupid to go away
review_detailed_main:
The movie was somewhat creative, but seriously, is this what humor has become? Find the lowest, sophomoric thing to say or do or happen and put it on screen.

As a kid, I loved Land of the Lost TV show. This could have been as good a movie as Journey to the Center of the Earth, which had humor, but with heart and it stuck closely with the original story. Will Ferrill is not 20 years old any more and playing an idiot constantly is tiring and boring. Jerry Lewis knew he couldn't play the Nutty Professor all his life. He graduated to playing more serious roles.

The movie was plain stupid, like the late eighties and nineties films of young teens doing idiotic things. After 30 years, the humor is now adults being moronic (see tv shows like The English Teacher) or movies that don't make you laugh.

Sad, when watching old Carol Burnett Show repeats are funnier.

This movie was great, if you were a fan of will's witty comedy style. If you wern't familiar or did not like will ferrell's previous movie you will probably not like this movie.

'It is a COMEDY' and being a will ferrell movie unless your children like him It wouldn't be the best movie to go see. I will assume those who have judged this harshly will most likely not like his other famous movies like Anchorman, Blades of glory,Taladega Nights & Step Brothers. This movie has plenty of one liners, some singing, and all and all is a great movie. This is definitely the movie to see if you are a fan of will and like his comedic style, he does not fail to live up to his representation.

I adore this movie. Seriously. It is hilarious and a great watch. I honestly could not stop laughing! I would definitely watch it again and again... well to be honest I have seen it about 10 times already and I am still not sick of it. And of course Will Ferrel is a very intelligent and funny actor. Land of the Lost, Elf, Stepbrothers and Stranger than Fiction are all my favorite movies. Just to see the low rating on this hilarious comedy is very sad. I believe this movie deserves more credit than that. If you have not seen this movie I highly recommend it. And if Personally I would rate this movie 10/10 and so should you.

It seems that most people who didn't like this movie missed the whole point. It's a take-off on a Seventies Saturday morning TV show, and they captured the fun and the weirdness of that show perfectly. The "Land of the Lost" itself is imaginatively realized, the visuals are excellent and the humor is exactly the sort to be expected. If you can accept the movie for what it is, you're certain to have a good time. And if you're a fan (like me) of the original, you'll probably enjoy it even more, especially the way in which various oddities from the series were woven into a single story.

Personally, I'd like to see a sequel!

I have never seen a movie quite as good as Land of the Lost. I admit I was pretty apprehensive about seeing it, having heard all of the buzz about a possible Oscar nod for my hero, and yours, The Amazing, Fantastic, Mr Will Ferrell!!! I won't go into details about the movie of course, I will say this...

Mr Ferrell's portrayal of Dr Marshall really spoke to me on such a deep and artistic level that I feel as if, I was touched by the hand of God.

I have lived a more fulfilled life having seen it, and can not wait till it's DVD release! I will purchase it on Blu-ray as well!! I urge anyone and everyone with the means to see this movie (at the theater) to rush out and hand out your hard earned cash (or mom and dad's) and see this wonderful addition to the medium of celluloid! 9 stars!!

You know what? I'm sick of people bashing movies like these. What kind of people am I talking about? The person who left the comment before this one. Land of the Lost is a great movie, hands down. Everybody is a critic these days. "Oh, I know exactly what makes a movie good, and this is not it." I hate that.

Everybody thinks movies have to have a major point. All movies must make you have an epiphany. When did that happen? You know what movies really are? Stories. Adventures. Plots. It doesn't matter.

Land of the Lost is a great movie. It brings laugh to everybody -- Little kids, adults, teenagers, and even senile old people. So what does it matter that when you leave the theater you say, "Oh, Land of the Lost did not make me a better person. I did not have an epiphany. I do not feel like a better person. The world is not better." Calm down. You expect too much.

This movie will make you laugh. Will Ferrell is fabulous in this movie. "Oh, he's just like every other Will Ferrell character I have ever seen..." Shut up. No, it's not. Who cares that he plays characters that do dumb things, and stretch reality. It's funny! There is not a person who walked out of the theater who didn't laugh at least 30 times.

And if you don't like Will Ferrell, don't see the movie. Like the person before this. "I don't even like Will Ferrell, but I figured I might as well see the movie so I can have more material to bash on him with." Even if you don't like him, see the movie. He plays a role in the celebrity world. You have Meryl Streep, if you will, who plays the serious, Oscar roles. You have Johnny Depp who plays the varying roles which are always great. And you have Will Ferrell, who plays the comedy roles that make you laugh at dumb things.

And I love it. What would the world be without it? Land of the Lost. A great movie. See it. It's not a waste of time. It's brilliant.

And scene.

review_title: Even better than the one positive review I read before seeing this movie
review_detailed_main:
Will Farrell is up to his usual tricks as the haughty former co-ed, Marshall. The laughs keep coming and the jokes never stop in this funny re-make of the hit 1970s' TV series. Will Ferrell had a long way to recover after his most recent picture plumb-bomb and came out face-first and ahead of the game with this crowd-pleaser.

On their way to discovering the source of the mysterious Quantum Physics particles, Tacky-onns, Marshall and Holly stop at a theme park in the desert. There, they are hosted on a water theme ride by the adventurous, precocious Will. Getting close to the source of the radiation, they fall down a giant waterfall, where upon they,(along with the shocked and entertained viewers) are whistled down a hole and immediately whisked off to a world of adventure and scurrilous fun, it is of course, The Land of the Lost!

review_title: A solid and strangely underrated comedy
review_detailed_main:
I really wanted to give this movie a 9 to counter the unjustly low score it has on IMDb, but if I rate it honestly, it's a solid 8--no more, no less.

First off, Will Ferrell is great. His sense of humor seems to connect with most people, and even though, like most comedians, he plays very similar characters in all of his movies, it's still always enjoyable to see him on screen. And he's made some great movies: Anchorman, Old School, and Talladega Nights are hard movies to top, but few comedians can crank out so many hits in so short a time.

Land of the Lost may not be quite the gut-buster that a few past Will Ferrell movies have been, but it's still an exceptionally well-written and entertaining film. I'd put it on the same level as Step Brothers, though it's more accessible and makes use of more sight gags than offbeat humor and awkward situations.

The chemistry between the cast is terrific, and Danny McBride's whitetrash goofball antics really compliments Ferrell's pretentious yet clueless scientist character. And even though the movie has its fair share of quotable one-liners, a lot of the film's less overt humor isn't dialog-derived but rather situational. They're scenes that remind you of your own experiences in similar social situations presented with subtle humor that you just can't help but chuckle at. There are many of these familiar and extremely relatable moments interspersed throughout the film that keep you grinning between the tear-inducing sight gags and side-achingly funny dialog. And it's this mixture of comedic elements that keeps the pace of the movie just right and makes the film and its characters so endearing.

This isn't a comedy that relies on the character's extreme awkwardness or that's filled with cringe-inducing embarrassing moments. The humor is accessible and characteristic of Ferrell's films but still remains fresh and dynamic. And it's because of all of this that I really can't imagine why so many people dislike the movie. Still, I think if you enjoyed films like Talladega Nights or Year One (another underrated film), you'll enjoy this well above average comedy.

I Wasn't Expecting A Great Movie When I Saw The Ratings! But don't listen to ratings!!! I Have Seen It Twice, June 6th, and June 11th. The Dinosaur Looked So Real, The Greatest Movie Ever! The Best Scene Was When They Were In The Cave & Rick (Will Ferrel) Sadi That If It Came To Starvaion He Would Cook & Eat Chaka! Will Ferrel & Danny McBride are Great Actors! I Will Def Buy It On DVD! I Will See It Again! and Again! Love it & Will Always Love It! GO SEE IT! I Don't Know What Ese To Say. AMAZING! GREAT! Gosh, Best Movie Ever. Chaka hates Rick, which is funny. It's A Great Movie! Lots Of Bad Words, Which Is The Main Reason It's Rated PG-13. I Haven't Seen The Original Series, But I've Seen Clips On YouTube, and This Movie, WAS WAY BETTER! GO AND SEE THIS MOVIE!

review_title: Land of the lost much better then expected
review_detailed_main: Perhaps it's just me, but for those who did not enjoy this movie may have been in the wrong state of mind for this. I have seen my share of terrible comedies lately but I have to say that I really did enjoy this movie and i thought it was put together well enough so that the comedy of it would keep the viewer entertained throughout. The story and the dialog may have not been written as well as it could of been although the movie was made for Will Farrel and Danny McBride and the comedy of it was ridiculously hilarious. If you don't enjoy this movie then you should probably think back on any moments you may have found funny. Overall, before you watch this movie don't be expecting agreat movie, but instead be expecting a fun movie that should keep you entertained.

review_title: Either you get it or you don't
review_detailed_main:
This is a deeply spiritual movie. Most people will understandably not "get" this movie because their minds have been conditioned (through no fault of their own) to be blind to its truth. However, the people who get it simply *know* it. They can't offer rational explanations for it because there have none. They know it through intuition rather than through rationing.

How was I able to *understand* this movie? I have watched it several times. More times than I can count. Each time I watched it I discovered more and more novel layers of genius (not least comedy genius). My latest revelation, after having watched the (perhaps) 15th time, it that the story of this movie is real. Perhaps not in its smallest detail, but the main storyline happened. It is no joke.

For those also trying to understand this movie, watching it several times can definitely be of help. But it is important to watch it with an open mind. I've heard that watching it while on certain drugs might also help the viewer to know this movie, although I would not encourage that.

I haven't watched the TV show about the Land of the Lost from the 70's. But I really enjoyed this comedy.

Sure one has to ignore some things that make no sense. Like how can Holly speak Chaka's language so well? But this is easy to ignore. This is after all a silly comedy, the kind Will Ferrell does. And one gets to enjoy it if one is also into this kind of humor.

And I must say I was not expecting all the things that were about to come. I loved the whole quarrel between Dr. Marshall and the dinosaur. As well as all the stuff that he was teaching them about the dino. And Chaka was also a great addition to the story. Lots of laughter and action. Nothing serious about the movie.

I love the idea being this Land of the Lost comedy, and oh my god is the execution on set design, costuming, visual landscape, and CG/practical effect blending excellent. It all looks great, brimming with character and fun design choices.

The comedy alternates wildly between very genuinely funny, and floppy, all dependent on Ferrell, Friel, and McBride's improv delivery. I really enjoyed the banter for the most part - it just feels organic and fun, and moves at a quick enough pace that you're not rolling your eyes when a joke doesn't land. It IS that quippy style of comedy, though, so you basically need to go into LotL expecting the characters to be clowning around nonstop for the duration of the adventure. It's just improv actors having fun in a comedic role with a very self-aware plot - I'm very happy they went all the way, and built the comedy around the actors.

Action is generally very fun and well-presented, with the camera-work keeping everything in-frame and clear without getting chaotic. Again, I cannot say enough good about the way this movie looks and plays out.

No real complaints beyond a few recurring jokes that don't really land - the showtunes gag in particular didn't do much for me, and I get slightly annoyed by how (for the first half of the movie) Friel's character's just there to have McBride make crass jokes at and Chaka to grope. She does really come into her own during the second half, though, so eh, not that big a deal.

A good, fun movie.

review_title: What is wrong with you people?
review_detailed_main: C'mon people. Some of you are too critical for your own good. I'm a thirty-three year old prude, and I love this movie. I saw it twice and both times the whole audience was laughing right along with me. And both times, my friend's 14 year old daughter was laughing along with us. And yes I shielded her eyes from Will Ferrell's crotch shot. I haven't laughed this much since Hot Rod! This movie ranks write up there with my favorites: Napoleon Dynamite, Nacho Libre, Talledega Nights, and of course the aforementioned Hot Rod. So, like I said, C'MON PEOPLE! Get a grip and get over yourselves! You know you liked it! Quit yer bellyachin'. And by the way, isn't everyone that grew up watching the original dead by now anyways? Geeez.

review_title: Very good, for the right audience...

review_detailed_main:
There are just some types of movies that critics will never love, and this is one of them. Were they expecting Shakespeare? Leave your brain at home and enjoy this movie, that's the best advice I can give you. Don't nitpick this movie to death. I was never once bored or annoyed by this film. I had read all of the bad reviews, and I was prepared to skip this movie, but I'm glad that I didn't.

They had good pacing in the movie, they didn't waste any time with slow scenes. Every scene had something interesting happening in it. By comparison, "Up!" the Pixar hit film of the summer, and critically acclaimed, was also good, but it definitely had some minor slow moments in it that bored you.

One person was complaining that there was too much profanity in this movie for young kids. Didn't the US PG-13 rating give you a clue that this would be the case? Set your expectations and you'll get far with this movie.

Look.... ya'll are being overly dramatic saying that this film is "stupid" and a "waste of time".... just remember: not only did you watch it, you reviewed it!!!! So clearly you have time to waste.

Danny and Will displayed classic comedic acting (outlandish, raunchy, ridiculous) but did you know that Cha-ka is Jorma from the Lonely Island Trio? Its physically impossible to have that much talent in a movie and give it one or two stars!!!

Worth a watch, and a laugh.

review_title: Ignore critics and enjoy. Very funny
review_detailed_main: One of the most funniest movies ever. My children loves it as mixes science fiction with high humour on differences approach. Even sex is made humoristic. Recommended for all audiences with a glimpse on tech.

It's a fun movie with a couple of standout moments. The casting was well chosen since the comedy tone is given in the counterpoint of Will Ferrell and Danny McBride who have great chemistry on the screen. For those of us who grew up watching Land of the Giants and similar series, this film takes us back to old and dear memories where what mattered was the story and the characters and visual effects served as support. It is in that spirit that this film emerges and allows us to laugh and enjoy a good time. The end, freed from all negative connotations, is the demonstration that it is a well-rounded, funny film that is worth seeing several times.

review_title: Meant to be stupid so it works!
review_detailed_main:
This is the type of film you watch when you want to spend a couple of hours being brain dead and maybe having a few laughs. I loved it. Sometimes we get caught up in having to judge films for the deepness or the message, and it all good, but occasionally it's nice to just relax and watch Will Ferrell at his best, acting like a socially retarded nerd. There was no real message in the film, there was no moral to the story. There were gross scenes, funny scenes, stupid scenes, impossible scenes and outright hilarious scenes. The movie is like all of Ferrell's movies, but that's good. I don't remember the name of his male costar but he's awesome. He's got the best voice, face and personality for these types of films.

So relax and watch it without expecting "art". And don't compare it to the original film, because I'm pretty sure it's not meant to be a comparison!
I've watched this movies lots of times and It still draws a smile on my face. It's a hilarious movie and certainly worth your time!

review_title: i don't know why people thought it was bad
review_detailed_main:
I honestly can't think of a single decent reason people didn't like this movie. Sure, there wasn't that much "character development" but who cares! It's a comedy, and a pretty damn funny one at that.

Will Ferrel was hilarious as always and had an amazing screen presence with Danny Mcbride.(who also was very funny)

All in all an entertaining movie that should make 95% of its audience laugh, which is the point of this type of film.

So to all the people who complain about the story line or character development, you just aren't able to enjoy a funny movie.

p.s-to all the people out there who also have problems with action movies because "their wrist's weren't flying back when they were shooting two desert eagles in mid-air." (see Boondock Saints 2) you once again just don't have the capability to enjoy an entertaining movie without pointing out some sort of unrealistic feature.

review_title: Will Ferrell at his arrogant, immature, un-informed best!
One of the best and funniest movies ever made
Good use of 100 million budget and some original will ferrel humor
review_detailed_main:
I was going to see this movie with low expectations thanks to the many users at IMDb.com who almost hate anything that Hollywood makes for some unknown reason. I walked out happy and laughed my way home at some of the scenes in it.

I honestly didn't expect it to have swear words since Canada rated it PG, but it felt like a 14A movie, well, very close to it because Danny McBride always entertains the audience with his type of sarcastic and witty humor. Apparently it's supposed to be a remake of the TV show, but I could care less, because I obviously laughed at almost every scene.

They used the budget well and managed to make some above average special effects. There were obviously some nods to other movies like Star Trek, The Matrix, and many others. I might pick this up for blu-ray if it has bd-live and a good amount of special features. 8/10 for great references to other films and laugh out loud, humor.

I grew up in the 80's & 90's so I still have the ability to think, and I wasn't conditioned to only find hollywood propaganda funny. I am a comedy buff & the greatest standup comedian ever was George Carlin. The greatest comedy duo ever was Richard Pryor & Gene Wilder so you now know I know comedy. Now, I've never been a big fan of Will Ferrell, and only care for a few of his films, but this movie I will say is just about perfect. Comedy gold! Even my humourless daughter laughs at this & even said there isn't a none-funny moment in it. If you aren't afraid to laugh at something funny, or use your brain to find something funny then this is a must-watch. Whenever it's on Prime I watch it as often as possible. The first time I watched it I had to keep pausing & would laugh so hard I'd cry. It doesn't matter how many times I watch it, either, I laugh every time. I no longer find SNL funny, and haven't heard of any funny liberal comedians, so if those are not your cup of tea either then watch this. You will not be disappointed.
Three words: what the f. Thats what the movie is about... LOVE IT

I am not going to waste any of yall's time... This is a Will Ferrell movie !!! If you were expecting a snow white comedy, go watch it (Snow White of course) !!! I liked this movie, I laughed hard at some point during the movie.

Again, this is not a kids movie, Will Ferrell is on it, please use common sense (if you do not know who Will Ferrell is, do some research, do not take your kids dumbly and blindly to watch a movie and then post your bad reviews !!! COMMON SENSE). If you want a kids movie, watch Ice Age or a Disney movie and for crying out loud people, if you are looking for a movie with a depth or a plot, please use common sense... Watch the pianist or some other boring Oscar worth movie BUT not expect this one to be Oscar material or to enlight your life and solve all your bitterness !!! COMMON SENSE !!! PS: For those of you bitter people... or with a refined sense of humor ? Do not expect miracles... If you can not laugh with a stupid joke... Please do not watch this movie... As a matter of fact, take your bitterness somewhere else. Thanks.

Hope this helps.

review_title: Very entertaining and funny sci-fi comedy!
review_detailed_main:
I was surprised to see an overall score rating on IMDb as low as this movie gets. This movie is entertaining, has good humor, even has sound logic "in the universe it's set in", what more could you want? Giving scores of 1 out of 10 means you found it absolutely unwatchable, and in my opinion this movie would certainly not count for that.

Acting is good, although on rare occasions feels a little forced - the only main reason it's not getting full marks from me. Effects are up to standard, there is a story to it that is well-executed and it's entertaining and keeping your attention. It also provides nice hints and jabs to previous blockbuster movies that feel natural and are honestly acted out - kudos for that! Just because a flic is a comedy doesn't mean it's necessarily a kids movie; and this movie underlines that once more: there are a lot of adult jokes and insinuations, that kids wouldn't get at all.

More can't really be said without getting into spoiling the movie - so I'll just leave this review with the recommendation: watch it if you like comedy with a good dose of sci-fi!

review_title: Top stupid funny movie of all times
review_detailed_main:
Wheter you've seen the Saturday morning shows of Land of the Lost or not, if you just empty your mind you will find it very funny. Don't expect a lot and just let it roll over you. It's fun. One our family's favorite movies. Dr. Rick Marshall is not a disappointment and Cha-ka is effortlessly funny.

What sets "Land of the Lost" apart is its fearless commitment to embracing the absurd. Unlike many blockbuster films that follow a predictable formula, this movie throws logic to the wind and fully commits to its surreal premise. This might be off-putting to some viewers who expect a more conventional narrative, but for others, it's precisely what makes the film so enjoyable. "Land of the Lost" is not afraid to be silly, to push the boundaries of believability, and to invite the audience to simply have fun.

"Land of the Lost" isn't just a movie I enjoy-it's a film that changed my perspective and, in its own quirky way, enriched my life.

If there's one thing I can't understand, is how a movie like G.I. Joe can get a rating above 6 whereas Land of the Lost only gets 5.4...really, I don't get it. G.I. Joe was horrible: dumb plot, crappy actors, dull dialogs and really dull humor, special effects for everything (even car chases were completely faked)...Hollywood ruined yet another childhood hero for so many of us.

Unlike G.I. Joe, with Land of the Lost, you knew exactly what to expect. I mean come on, Ferrell traveling through time to some parallel universe to save the climate crisis? Did you expect something like a mix between Al Gore's "inconvenient truth" and terminator? People who rated this movie so low should stop pretending they are smart, they're just making fools of themselves. This movie is idiotic and it doesn't pretend to be smart at all. If you can enjoy it, then your IQ must be pretty high. Else...well lets say you should ask yourself some questions about your own intelligence...

Its just like those who go see a movie without looking it up on the internet before and then feel literally "insulted" because they didn't expect it to have, I don't know, sexual and crude humor...*DUH!*, if I had to take my kids to a movie, i'd look for what is appropriate before going to the movies...you can't say you didn't know, not in todays world.

Concerning the movie itself. Well, it has its flaws, obviously, but the only thing you need to do is take it for what it is: a Will Ferrell movie. I enjoyed it, really, I did, because I wasn't expecting it to tackle my intelligence. It was dumb and ridiculous, yet fun and entertaining. I must be honest, I thought it was going to suck before I watched it because of the ratings, allowing me to lower my expectations and in the end feel glad I saw it. And that comes from someone who usually never watches a movie when IMDb ratings are bellow 6...

In many ways, Land of the Lost is in the same vein as Army of Darkness (7.6/10, wow, people really didn't have sticks in their places where the sun don't shine back in 1993). Just grab yourself a pack of pop-corn, sit back and enjoy the ride, that's all there is to it.

This movie is super funny, I have no idea why it has such a low rating. I think it is one of Will Ferrell's best movies, so if you are a fan of him other films, you should check it out.

Not only is it funny, but it is very entertaining with the wild sci-fi plot, the crazy adventure, the over-the-top sets and the fast pace that never gets boring.

It is the type of movie that you can watch over and over again, and find new things to laugh at each time. Obviously it's not to be taken too seriously and the plot is full of holes, but who cares! That's a big part of what makes it so funny.

If you are looking for a fun movie that will entertain and be a creative blend of sci-fi, fantasy, and comedy, this is not to be missed!

review_title: A comedy that is worth seeing more than once

review_detailed_main:
Well, I think that many people took this film very seriously when it should be just a simple LOL adventure... just that.

First, it had no scientific facts, no drama, no puzzles to solve but simply absurd comedy. This film is meant to entertain and relax and it does if you watch it without prejudices. Also, it has the elements of parody to different genres, so it should be absurd.

Will Ferrell may not be some great comedian, but he really did a good job with this character. A simple-minded scientist, who sometimes has no respect for the others, a little bit narcissistic know-it-all pain in the ass. All the other characters were placed good also. All of them mixed up give us a twisted gang that is out of place and time.

T-Rex is also an important protagonist of the film, and is scarily entertaining. His CGI is really good and because of that he is a part of some original jokes and without it this film would be a big time disaster. I really like dinosaurs, I loved them since I was a kid, so I was thrilled when I saw this one in the trailer. All in all, he is not a real dinosaur here, he is a comedian... something different for a change, and all of you who want to see a real dinosaurs and maybe some gore, go and watch some of the Spielberg's masterpieces, those are some scientific-based reptiles. This one here is, like I said, to entertain.

Basically, if you want to relax, get some laughs and enjoy for 101 min, this is the movie for you. Leave all the common sense and criticism aside and simply enjoy. This is how this film should be watched.

review_title: Sorry if You Don't Get It...It's a Generational Movie
review_detailed_main:
I loved it! But unless you're between the ages of 53-60 (or so) and had grown up watching the original series as an 8-15-year-old, you're just not going to get it and understand the hilarity of it all.

Yes, there ARE several crude moments - what do you expect when watching a WF movie?! - but as usual (WHEN watching his movies), I laughed heartily throughout.

Sadly, due to the very slim timeline for which the original series was popular with kids - and even then, I doubt it was hugely so - this movie never stood a chance regardless of WHO starred in/wrote it. Luckily, however, I grew up within that generation and loved the movie.

It wasn't a mistake, Will...it was awesome!

Entertaining, remarkable animations, two hours of sympathy.

Some people disagree and write that it is "garbage".... I think the garbage is in your head.

This movie is kind of like "dumb and dumber". It's ridiculous, unbelievable, dioic, stupid, and FUN! If you want something meaningful, deep, or insightful, this is not for you. If you want some Saturday night fun, a family time-together, this is your movie.
