Will Ferrell and Danny Mcbride are awesome as usual. I wish Chaka brought some of that hypnotic drink my way lol!!

review_title: A really fun under-rated adventure with psychedelic flare!!
review_detailed_main:
If you are planning on reading the negative reviews, let me sum them up for you: "I had herd good things about Baskin & Robbins Icecream , so I goed accepting a good meal. What I got was an abdominal . It was banana that had was split down the middle . They called it an "Banana Split". How original? .. There were with scoops of chocolate , strawberryandvanilla ice cream in middle.. Whom in there right mine done did that ?? As if that weren't not bad enough,the icecream was topped whith carmle , chocolate and strawberry syrips and whipped cream sprinkles , chopped nuts and Maraschino , cherries ? GROSS !! Only a little sissy child would eat such a concoction . I My two year old could make this !! I only eat Garlic infused Okra Flambay served on fresh Himalayan Cedar sprouts cooked by learnt Chefs. Watch this movie only if you are want to become uncivilized idiot!!"

As for me, milk came out my nose and I peed a little when Chaka grabbed her boobs... and you can too! But only if you watch this movie.

Overall Land of the Lost did not get the credit it deserved. As a huge Will Ferrell fan, Land of the Lost was just added on to one of my favorites. In order to appreciate his humor, as a person, you have to be extremely "stoned" or just understand his level of sarcasm. The lightheartedness of Ferrell's humor and psychedelic twist to this film is what made it fun. Although it was a big budget movie people expected to much from it, often times watching many of Will Ferrell's movies, you have to go in with an open mind.

In this story three people go to a mysterious island called 'The land of lost'. There they meet a caveman called Chaka. They lost the machine to go back to the real world. So their adventure begins when they explore and go on finding the machine. It was funny adventurous movie. I have always seen serious adventurous but this one was good. Everyone watch this movie and especially I suggest people who are sad to watch this movie to laugh.

I've seen "Land of the Lost" a couple of times on satellite TV, and my appreciation for it has deepened with each viewing. The subtle, sophisticated touches (listen for "Chaka's" sotto voce responses); the bizarre call-backs to "A Chorus Line"; Leonard Nimoy's voice cameo; the myriad pop-culture references and the musical choices are all pitch-perfect. The CGI and sound-design are top-notch.

Will Ferrell's over-the-top performance tends (as usual) to overshadow the subtleties of the Silberling's terrific direction, but as Sci-Fi comedies go, this is among the best ever.

I don't understand all the "haters"... I suppose there could be a peculiar mind-set that equates unnecessarily and excessively harsh criticism with intelligence and discernment. Personally, I think most of these reviewers just don't 'get it'.

review_title: The Land of the Lost is a humdinger!
Not the complete disaster most people call it.

review_detailed_main: Yes it's cheesey nonsense but what do you expect. I have no idea why it gets slated on here the film is hysterical, much better than that Lala land crap.

review_title: Great movie, but don't expect it to be true to the original series or to be a kid movie
review_detailed_main: oh my god, critics actually hated this movie! They are clearly looking to deeply into this. YEah, it has bad special effects, sure, the actors are never serious, but thats the point! This is a purposely campy film spoofing an accidentally campy TV series. Perhaps its because I am 15 and never watched the original series, maybe thats why I enjoyed this. This really won't bring the older fans back into the theaters, but it should be enough to bring in a new generation of movie goers. It's a comedy for crying out loud, its meant to make you laugh, and if the only reason you want to see it is because you need a good laugh, you won't be disappointed. People expecting an action packed Indiana Jones like movie, well, this isn't exactly for you, or for the older fans of the TV series. The idea is simple, watch the movie, laugh it out, go home wait a few months, bye the DVD, and watch it again. By th way, this isn't as kid friendly as the TV series was, don't go bringing kids under 5 in the theater.

To anyone who didn't see Wil Ferrel's genius in his Saturday Night Live performances, well you're missing an element of humanity that cannot be implanted or explained...you're probably the same people who didn't recognize the hilarious genius of this film either...IT'S SUPPOSED TO BE A SUPER SILLY, LAUGH OUT LOUD FLICK...AND IT SURPASSED THIS GOAL IN EVERY WAY!...FOR THOSE WHO SAW THE GENIUS I'M SPEAKING OF..BRAVO!...'GOOD FORM EVERYONE!'...'DON'T BE AFRAID TO POINT YOUR TOES!'...This movie is extremely well written...(FOR WIL FERREL)...and doesn't disappoint from start to finish... If you are in the mood for a silly, silly movie with lot's of laughs > This is exactly what the Doctor (Rick Marshall) ordered! ...DON'T MISS THIS ONE UNLESS YOU ARE SO STUCK UP THAT EVEN LOADS OF FIBER IN YOUR DIET WON'T HELP, THEN MAYBE YOU ARE BEYOND HELP!..OTHERWISE, DON'T MISS THIS FLICK...In short, IT'S SIMPLY HILARIOUS...SIMPLY SILLY AND REALLY FUN & REALLY FUNNY!!!

Its was meant to be a take on a cartoon for gods sake , its not an interpretation of a Jules Verne classic. It was so different to any other movie around at the time, its unpredictability was excellent. crazy script , yes crazy acting ,yes crazy fun to watch = defiantly

I WOULD LOVE MORE OF THIS TYPE OF FILM MAKING , ITS CALLED FUN TO WATCH

the most lovely thing about the film is the story's ability to go in directions, that a conventional Hollywood predictable goofy adventure would avoid like a plague of comedy lines from Ricky gervais at an Oscar ceremony to the art of making boring.

i also would like to mention that movies like the goonies and ghost buster considered to be Hollywood comedy adventures leave me feeling like I just received news, that I won the lottery but I'm 89 years old. useless to any one who wants to live!!!

review_title: Dany Mcbride is Awesome! Another Ferrell classic.
review_detailed_main: If you need a good silly comedy then this is your ticket. I recently saw Year One and was really let down by this movie, and I had my expectations kinda low for Land of the Lost but I was really surprised with how much fun I had with this movie. The movie is basically carried by three people and they are great. Danny McBride is at his finest here and Will Ferrell is classic Ferrell. Jorma Taccone is great as Chaka, when I first saw this character I thought I would get annoyed but he really knew how too play it, and the friendship he builds with the other characters mainly McBride is hilarious. I even watched the deleted scenes right after the movie because I could not get enough. I only wish I would have seen this in 3D but its great on DVD at home. Another thing that was cool were all the Sci-Fi homages. And the special effects are pretty good. If you need a good laugh and a good fun Sci-Fi adventure movie then this is for you.

Getting a maximum rating because it is a really good adventure movie with fun jokes both mimic, visual and spoken.

Details in the movie are really great done from little tiny visuals in scenes that don't even matter but they do set the mood of this film.

It has a lot of story in a short amount of time but it does it really well.

Have to rate this as probably a classic adventure that is amusing to watch and re-watched.

Best adventure film in a long while certainly of 2009 hopefully they won't make a sequel because this is as good as it gets and will be remembered like this.

Credits to whole cast/crew that made this film, thanks.

Don't be scared off by the low rating, this comedy is definitely worth your time. Danny McBride and Will Ferrell aren't the only source of laughs with its crazy scenes and plot. It manages to be exciting and adventurous without being strung out and forced. All the comedy flows, nothing feels forced or tired. Every scene has humor in it, even during serious points of the movie. Unlike Adam Sandler movies, where everything is forced and cliché, this is fun to watch. Despite a relatively low budget, the fx aren't bad at all except where they're supposed to look cheap for humorous effect. Memorable movie worthy of watching many times.

This movie was actually enjoyable the whole time watching, it has a lot of dumb witty jokes and scenes that make it fun to watch .Best relatable example I can give for it is that it's like an older version of "Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle".

This film as so much, a crazy adventure, jokes/good humor, plenty of cringe moments. Great movie for some laughs and a good chilled time.

review_title: To appreciate it, you've got to be a fan of the "Big Cat" himself, Will Ferrell....

review_detailed_main: All these hater reviews, had great one liners. Matt lauer can suck it.

review_title: I laughed a lot! Thoroughly enjoyed it.
review_detailed_main: I don't see how this could get such a low score. I'm an extremely picky rater and my husband says I expect too much out of movies only to be disappointed. But I found this movie to be hilarious. I've watched it a few times. Funny stuff.

review_title: Great Homage To The 1970's TV Series

review_detailed_main:
The movie is based loosely on some technobabble things about time travel, which is an insult to the intelligence of those of us who have read about it in a newspaper or heard about it somewhere, because the theory as treated in the movie does not coincide with physical facts, and the plot is represented by subjects that have no idea about what they are talking about.

Of course! what did you expect; that they represented time travel as it happens in real life? that the parallel universes looked like the parallel universes we already know? what kind of bloody idiotic moron would go to a kids movie then starts criticizing it because the characters were childish, or because the plot was so simple that kids could understand it even though it was advertised that way? No, this is not a kids movie, but it follows the same situation where somebody spoofs a zombie movie and mocks the hero because zombies walk slowly, and everybody criticizes the movie because now they don't feel like their heroes are so super after running away from slow walking zombies.

It said 'Will Ferrell' in the cover, what did you expected. It is a comedy; it was never presented any other way. There are lots of bad reviews because the series made you feel intellectual when you watched it as a kid but now you feel ridiculed. Yes, that's what normally happens when you see something that is a spoof of something else. Also, if you feel ridiculed when you took your kids to see how awesome was the series you watched as a kid, and instead you show them potty humor, you may have thought about it before taking your kids to a movie that was rated PG13

Actually, It is a good think they made this movie, as it's been long since a comedy like this was made, from the times of 'Naked Gun', 'Hot Shots' or even 'Top Secret' (and maybe Mystery Men). Nobody knows how to make good comedies anymore.

On the other hand, is incredible that thru the movie all actors do their part with a straight face; is like they were born to play these characters.. and all wrapped in a beautiful photography. All desert scenes are just picture perfect, and could perfectly be taken as a still and be framed. The CGI, despite some comments, was really nice and convincing; and puppet effects were also adequate in a cheesy way that makes the movie be aware of itself. Is like they were breaking the fourth wall all the time, without actually doing it once.

Is a great movie for what it is, and sorry it did not made you feel like you wanted to be the main character. Suck it up.
I loved this move. Brilliant. Can't stop laughing. Wondering why they picked the song from the Chorus Line? That cracked me up.

I really enjoyed the OG series from 1974. The reboot series from 1991 was okay and this movie I just LOVED. It was so funny and entertaining. The only bad thing about it, is that a sequel yet not have come. There are so many funny and hilarious scenes in this movie. Like the one when they are being chased by the T-Rex and in the middle of running for their life, Ferrell tells him they have to stop for a photo as proof, and not only does he stop, he actually strikes a pose while doing it with the chasing man-eating T-Rex in the background coming closer and closer. Oh, man, I just smile from ear-to-ear just thinking about it now. That is just one of many incredibly funny scenes that this movie provides. There also many references to the OG series, like when Ferrell sings the intro music to the series. Some memorable quotes: "We're gonna cook ... and eat ... Chaka" "-I never trust a guy wearing a tunic. -You live by that rule? -It never steered me wrong." To mention a couple. I truly hope that a sequel will eventually come. It deserves a sequel. And I recommend this movie to everyone that enjoys a good laugh. And if you also like dinosaurs and secret worlds, then you will like it even more.

review_title: what you'd expect: Will Ferrell doing what he does
